com.adobe.cq.commerce.api.classification

Interface ClassificationManager


  • @ProviderType
public interface ClassificationManager
    The ClassificationManager provides methods to retrieve, update, create and update product classifications. Since 6.2

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ClassificationAttribute addAttribute(java.lang.String categoryPath, java.lang.String name, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
      Adds an attribute to the specified category.

      Adds a sub category to the specified category.

      Assigns products to the category.

      Returns a product classification for the given path or an ID uniquely identifying the Classification to the external commerce engine.

      Retrieves the classification categories in which at least one of the product is assigned.

    • Method Detail

      • getClassification

        Classification getClassification(java.lang.String path)
        Returns a product classification for the given path or an ID uniquely identifying the Classification to the external commerce engine. It returns null if given path/ID is not a product classification or is not defined
        Parameters:
        path - path/ID that represents the classification
        Returns:
        The Classification representing the classification.

      • getCategory

        ClassificationCategory getCategory(java.lang.String path)
        Returns a classification category for the given path or an ID uniquely identifying the ClassificationCategory to the external commerce engine. It returns null if given path/ID is not a classification category or is not defined
        Parameters:
        path - path/ID that represents the category
        Returns:
        The ClassificationCategory representing the category.

      • getAttribute

        ClassificationAttribute getAttribute(java.lang.String path)
        Returns a classification attribute for the given path or an ID uniquely identifying the ClassificationAttribute to the external commerce engine. It returns null if given path/ID is not a classification attribute or is not defined
        Parameters:
        path - path/ID that represents the attribute
        Returns:
        The ClassificationAttribute representing the attribute.

      • createClassification

        Classification createClassification(java.lang.String parentPath,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
                             throws CommerceException
        Creates a product classification with a given name under the parentPath.
        Parameters:
        parentPath - parent path where classification needs to be created.
        name - The name for classification.
        properties - The additional data for product classification
        Returns:
        The Classification representing the created classification.
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the classification was not created

      • removeClassification

        void removeClassification(java.lang.String path)
                   throws CommerceException
        Removes the classification.
        Parameters:
        path - path/ID that represents the classification
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the classification was not removed

      • updateClassification

        void updateClassification(java.lang.String path,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
                   throws CommerceException
        Updates the classification.
        Parameters:
        path - path/ID that represents the classification
        properties - The additional data for product classification
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the classification was not updated

      • addRootCategory

        ClassificationCategory addRootCategory(java.lang.String classificationPath,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
                                throws CommerceException
        Adds a root category to the classification. The root category is the base category of the classification and does not have a parent category.
        Parameters:
        classificationPath - path/ID that represents the classification
        properties - The additional data for the root category
        Returns:
        The ClassificationCategory representing the created category.
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the root category was not created or if the classification already has a root category

      • addCategory

        ClassificationCategory addCategory(java.lang.String parentPath,
                                   java.lang.String name,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
                            throws CommerceException
        Adds a sub category to the specified category.
        Parameters:
        parentPath - parent path / ID that represents the parent category
        properties - The additional data for the category
        Returns:
        The ClassificationCategory representing the created category.
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the category was not created

      • removeCategory

        void removeCategory(java.lang.String path)
             throws CommerceException
        Removes the category.
        Parameters:
        path - path/ID that represents the category
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the category was not removed

      • updateCategory

                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
             throws CommerceException
        Updates the category.
        Parameters:
        path - path/ID that represents the category
        properties - The additional data for the category
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the category was not updated

                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
                              throws CommerceException
        Adds an attribute to the specified category.
        Parameters:
        categoryPath - path/ID that represents the category
        properties - The additional data for the attribute
        Returns:
        The ClassificationAttribute representing the created attribute.
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the attribute was not created

      • removeAttribute

        void removeAttribute(java.lang.String path)
              throws CommerceException
        Removes the attribute.
        Parameters:
        path - path/ID that represents the attribute
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the attribute was not removed

      • updateAttribute

        void updateAttribute(java.lang.String path,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
              throws CommerceException
        Updates the attribute.
        Parameters:
        path - path/ID that represents the attribute
        properties - The additional data for the attribute
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the attribute was not updated

      • orderBefore

        void orderBefore(java.lang.String srcAttributePath,
                 java.lang.String destAttributePath)
          throws CommerceException
        Inserts the referenced attribute srcAttributePath into the list of attributes at the position immediately before the referenced attribute destAttributePath. To insert the referenced attribute into last position, destAttributePath can be null.
        Parameters:
        srcAttributePath - Referenced attribute path/ID that needs to be moved in the order
        destAttributePath - Referenced attribute path/ID before which the srcAttributePath will be placed.
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the operation fails

      • assignProducts

        void assignProducts(java.lang.String categoryPath,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> productListDefinition)
             throws CommerceException
        Assigns products to the category.
        Parameters:
        categoryPath - path/ID that represents the category
        productListDefinition - A map of properties (key-value pairs) defining a set of products (can be used e.g. to define a query or a tag-based search)
        Throws:
        CommerceException - if the operation failed

      • getClassifications

        java.util.Collection<Classification> getClassifications(Product product)
        Retrieves the classifications in which the product is assigned.
        Parameters:
        product - The product
        Returns:
        A list of Classifications in which the product is assigned.

      • getClassificationCategories

        java.util.Collection<ClassificationCategory> getClassificationCategories(Product product)
        Retrieves the classification categories in which the product is assigned.
        Parameters:
        product - The product
        Returns:
        A list of ClassificationCategorys in which the product is assigned.

      • getClassifications

        java.util.Collection<Classification> getClassifications(java.util.List<Product> products)
        Retrieves the classifications in which at least one of the product is assigned.
        Parameters:
        products - The list of products
        Returns:
        A list of Classifications in which the products are assigned.
